title: High Livestock Production
description: In 2022, Malawi achieved a livestock production index of 190.08, indicating a significant increase compared to the base period of 2014-2016.

title: Low Patent Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2016, Malawi had only 1 patent application filed by nonresidents, indicating low international interest in patenting within the country.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2018, Malawi had a pupil-teacher ratio of 72.31 in secondary education, one of the highest in the world, indicating crowded classrooms.

title: Negative Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: In 2023, Malawi had an average transaction cost of -49.69% for sending remittances, suggesting significant incentives or subsidies.

title: Decline in Per Capita Income Growth
description: In 2019, Malawi experienced a -6.11% annualized average growth rate in per capita real survey mean consumption or income, indicating economic challenges.

title: Minimal Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, only 0.07% of economically active children aged 7-14 in Malawi were employed in manufacturing, reflecting low child labor in this sector.

title: High Part-Time Employment
description: In 2020, 76.09% of total employment in Malawi was part-time, indicating a high prevalence of part-time work in the labor market.
